thread.title: 2 dealers, 2 friends indicted in Vegas casino cheating case
thread.title_full: 2 dealers, 2 friends indicted in Vegas casino cheating case

author: KEN RITTER
title: 2 dealers, 2 friends indicted in Vegas casino cheating case
text:
John Locher 2 dealers, 2 friends indicted in Vegas casino cheating case 
FILE -- In this Aug. 14, 2014 file photo, the sun shines on the fountains of the Bellagio hotel and casino in Las Vegas. Two former craps dealers at the Bellagio and two of their friends have been accused of siphoning more than $1 million off gambling tables over nearly two years by quietly paying phantom bets. (AP Photo/John Locher, File) Uncredited 2 dealers, 2 friends indicted in Vegas casino cheating case 
This undated Clark County Detention Center booking photo shows former Bellagio casino craps dealer James R. Cooper Jr., 43, who was indicted Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015, in Las Vegas in a casino cheating and theft case. Two dealers and two friends are accused of siphoning more than $1 million off the craps tables at the Bellagio casino over nearly two years by quietly paying phantom bets. (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department Photo via AP) Uncredited 2 dealers, 2 friends indicted in Vegas casino cheating case 
This undated Clark County Detention Center booking photo shows former Bellagio casino craps dealer Mark Branco, 42, who was indicted Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015, in Las Vegas in a casino cheating and theft case. Two dealers and two friends are accused of siphoning more than $1 million off the craps tables at the Bellagio casino over nearly two years by quietly paying phantom bets. (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department Photo via AP) Uncredited 2 dealers, 2 friends indicted in Vegas casino cheating case 
This undated Clark County Detention Center booking photo shows Jeffrey D. Martin, 38, who was indicted Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015, in Las Vegas in a casino cheating and theft case. Two dealers and two friends are accused of siphoning more than $1 million off the craps tables at the Bellagio casino over nearly two years by quietly paying phantom bets. (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department Photo via AP) Uncredited 2 dealers, 2 friends indicted in Vegas casino cheating case 
This undated Clark County Detention Center booking photo shows Anthony G. Granito, who was indicted Wednesday, Sept. 30, 2015, in Las Vegas in a casino cheating and theft case. Two dealers and two friends are accused of siphoning more than $1 million off the craps tables at the Bellagio casino over nearly two years by quietly paying phantom bets. (Las Vegas Metropolitan Police Department Photo via AP) Posted: Thursday, October 1, 2015 5:26 pm | Updated: 8:00 pm, Thu Oct 1, 2015. 2 dealers, 2 friends indicted in Vegas casino cheating case Associated Press | 
LAS VEGAS (AP) — Two former casino dealers and two friends are accused of siphoning more than $1 million off craps tables over two years, using phantom bets at a posh Las Vegas Strip resort. 
James Russell Cooper Jr. and Mark William Branco were fired by the Bellagio after the scheme came to light and they were arrested in July 2014, prosecutor Jay P. Ramen said Thursday.
